item.title: Presentations
item.description: Mae Saslaw​ and John Bershaw. Mixing of the Willamette and Columbia Rivers across Sauvie Island, Oregon based on stable isotopes (δ​^18^O and δD) of surface water. 2018 view poster

item.title: Curriculum vitae
item.description: Education Expected 2024: Doctor of Philosophy, Geosciences Stony Brook University Bachelor of Science, Geology Portland State University 2019 Bachelor of Fine Arts, Writing Pratt Institute 2009 Research Graduate Research Assistant, Clumped isotope paleoclimate records from Miocene soil carbonates, Turkana Basin, Kenya Stony Brook University Department of Geosciences Fall 2019 – Present NSF Research Experience for Undergraduates, Stable isotopes of surface water across Sauvie Island, Oregon Portland State University Center for Climate and Aerosol Research
